benchmark_details.name: TAGIFY: LLM-powered Tagging Interface for Improved Data Findability on OGD portals
benchmark_details.overview: This paper proposes TAGIFY, an automated solution for tagging datasets to enhance their findability on Open Government Data (OGD) portals, utilizing large language models (LLMs) like GPT-3.5-turbo and GPT-4.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To automate the tagging process for datasets to improve findability on Open Government Data portals.

data.source: Estonian Open Data Portal and datasets published by the portal.
data.annotation: Automatically generated using large language models.

methodology.calculation: Calculated based on Likert scale ratings from user surveys.
methodology.interpretation: Tags rated by users as relevant or not, and overall usefulness of the tool assessed.
methodology.validation: Feedback collected through usability testing with over 20 users evaluating the efficiency and effectiveness of TAGIFY.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User data is processed according to OpenAI's enterprise privacy policy.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Consent was obtained from users prior to participation in surveys.
